001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.DungeonBoneGen;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType;
006import squidpony.squidmath.LightRNG;
007import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
008import squidpony.squidgrid.Spill;
009
010import java.awt.*;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.HashMap;
013import java.util.HashSet;
014
015/**
016 * The primary way to create a more-complete dungeon, layering different effects and modifications on top of
017 * a DungeonBoneGen's dungeon.
018 *
019 * @see squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility
020 *
021 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
022 * @author Tommy Ettinger - https://github.com/tommyettinger
023 */
024@Beta
025public class DungeonGenerator {
026
027    /**
028     * The effects that can be applied to this dungeon. More may be added in future releases.
029     */
030    public enum FillEffect
031    {
032        /**
033         * Water, represented by '~'
034         */
035        WATER,
036        /**
037         * Doors, represented by '+' for east-to-west connections or '/' for north-to-south ones.
038         */
039        DOORS,
040        /**
041         * Traps, represented by '^'
042         */
043        TRAPS
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * The effects that will be applied when generate is called. Strongly prefer using addWater, addDoors, and addTraps.
048     */
049    public HashMap<FillEffect, Integer> fx;
050    private DungeonBoneGen gen;
051    private int height, width;
052    public RNG rng;
053
054    private char[][] dungeon = null;
055
056    /**
057     * Get the most recently generated char[][] dungeon out of this class, which may be null if none have been
058     * generated with the method generate and setDungeon has not been called.
059     * @return a char[][] dungeon, or null.
060     */
061    public char[][] getDungeon() {
062        return dungeon;
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Change the underlying char[][]; only affects the toString method, and of course getDungeon.
067     * @param dungeon a char[][], probably produced by an earlier call to this class and then modified.
068     */
069    public void setDungeon(char[][] dungeon) {
070        this.dungeon = dungeon;
071        if(dungeon == null)
072        {
073            width = 0;
074            height = 0;
075            return;
076        }
077        width = dungeon.length;
078        if(width > 0)
079            height = dungeon[0].length;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Height of the dungeon in cells.
084     * @return Height of the dungeon in cells.
085     */
086    public int getHeight() {
087        return height;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Width of the dungeon in cells.
092     * @return Width of the dungeon in cells.
093     */
094    public int getWidth() {
095        return width;
096    }
097
098
099    /**
100     * Make a DungeonGenerator with a LightRNG using a random seed, height 40, and width 40.
101     */
102    public DungeonGenerator()
103    {
104        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
105        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
106        height = 40;
107        width = 40;
108        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Make a DungeonGenerator with the given height and width, and the RNG used for generating a dungeon and
113     * adding features will be a LightRNG using a random seed.
114     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells.
115     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells.
116     */
117    public DungeonGenerator(int width, int height)
118    {
119        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
120        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
121        this.height = height;
122        this.width = width;
123        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Make a DungeonGenerator with the given height, width, and RNG. Use this if you want to seed the RNG.
128     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells.
129     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells.
130     * @param rng The RNG to use for all purposes in this class; if this has been seeded and you want the same
131     *            results from map generation every time, don't use the same RNG object in other places.
132     */
133    public DungeonGenerator(int width, int height, RNG rng)
134    {
135        this.rng = rng;
136        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
137        this.height = height;
138        this.width = width;
139        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Copies all fields from copying and makes a new DungeonGenerator.
144     * @param copying
145     */
146    public DungeonGenerator(DungeonGenerator copying)
147    {
148        rng = new RNG(copying.rng.getRandomness());
149        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
150        height = copying.height;
151        width = copying.width;
152        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>(copying.fx);
153        dungeon = copying.dungeon;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Turns the given percentage of floor cells into water cells, represented by '~'. Water will be clustered into
158     * a random number of pools, with more appearing if needed to fill the percentage. Each pool will have randomized
159     * volume that should fill or get very close to filling the requested percentage, unless the pools encounter too
160     * much tight space. If this DungeonGenerator previously had addWater called, the latest call will take precedence.
161     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells to fill with water; this can vary quite a lot. It may be
162     *                   difficult to fill very high (approaching 100) percentages with water, though it will succeed.
163     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
164     */
165    public DungeonGenerator addWater(int percentage)
166    {
167        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
168        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
169        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER)) fx.remove(FillEffect.WATER);
170        fx.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
171        return this;
172    }
173    /**
174     * Turns the given percentage of viable doorways into doors, represented by '+' for doors that allow travel along
175     * the x-axis and '/' for doors that allow travel along the y-axis. If doubleDoors is true,
176     * 2-cell-wide openings will be considered viable doorways and will fill one cell with a wall, the other a door.
177     * If this DungeonGenerator previously had addDoors called, the latest call will take precedence.
178     * @param percentage the percentage of valid openings to corridors to fill with doors; should be between 10 and
179     *                   20 if you want doors to appear more than a few times, but not fill every possible opening.
180     * @param doubleDoors true if you want two-cell-wide openings to receive a door and a wall; false if only
181     *                    one-cell-wide openings should receive doors. Usually, this should be true.
182     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
183     */
184    public DungeonGenerator addDoors(int percentage, boolean doubleDoors)
185    {
186        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
187        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
188        if(doubleDoors) percentage *= -1;
189        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.DOORS)) fx.remove(FillEffect.DOORS);
190        fx.put(FillEffect.DOORS, percentage);
191        return this;
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Turns the given percentage of open area floor cells into trap cells, represented by '^'. Corridors that have no
196     * possible way to move around a trap will not receive traps, ever. If this DungeonGenerator previously had
197     * addTraps called, the latest call will take precedence.
198     * @param percentage the percentage of valid cells to fill with traps; should be no higher than 5 unless
199     *                   the dungeon floor is meant to be a kill screen or minefield.
200     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
201     */
202    public DungeonGenerator addTraps(int percentage)
203    {
204        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
205        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
206        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS)) fx.remove(FillEffect.TRAPS);
207        fx.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
208        return this;
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Removes any door, water, or trap insertion effects that this DungeonGenerator would put in future dungeons.
213     * @return this DungeonGenerator, with all effects removed. Can be chained.
214     */
215    public DungeonGenerator clearEffects()
216    {
217        fx.clear();
218        return this;
219    }
220
221    private HashSet<Point> removeAdjacent(HashSet<Point> coll, Point pt)
222    {
223        for(Point temp : new Point[]{new Point(pt.x+1, pt.y), new Point(pt.x-1, pt.y),
224                new Point(pt.x, pt.y+1), new Point(pt.x, pt.y-1)})
225        {
226            if(coll.contains(temp) && !(temp.x == pt.x && temp.y == pt.y))
227                coll.remove(temp);
228        }
229
230        return coll;
231    }
232    private HashSet<Point> removeAdjacent(HashSet<Point> coll, Point pt1, Point pt2)
233    {
234
235        for(Point temp : new Point[]{new Point(pt1.x+1, pt1.y), new Point(pt1.x-1, pt1.y),
236                new Point(pt1.x, pt1.y+1), new Point(pt1.x, pt1.y-1),
237                new Point(pt2.x+1, pt2.y), new Point(pt2.x-1, pt2.y),
238                new Point(pt2.x, pt2.y+1), new Point(pt2.x, pt2.y-1),})
239        {
240            if(coll.contains(temp) && !(temp.x == pt1.x && temp.y == pt1.y) && !(temp.x == pt2.x && temp.y == pt2.y))
241                coll.remove(temp);
242        }
243
244        return coll;
245    }
246
247    private HashSet<Point> viableDoorways(boolean doubleDoors, char[][] map)
248    {
249        HashSet<Point> doors = new HashSet<Point>();
250        Point temp = new Point(0, 0);
251
252        for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++, temp.x = x) {
253            for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++, temp.y = y) {
254                if(map[x][y] == '#')
255                    continue;
256                if (doubleDoors) {
257                    if (x >= map.length - 2 || y >= map[x].length - 2)
258                        continue;
259                    else {
260                        if (map[x+1][y] != '#' &&
261                                map[x + 2][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#'
262                                && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#'
263                                && map[x+1][y + 1] != '#' && map[x+1][y - 1] != '#') {
264                            if (map[x + 2][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 2][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
265                                doors.add(new Point(x, y));
266                                doors.add(new Point(x + 1, y));
267                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y), new Point(x + 1, y));
268                                continue;
269                            }
270                        } else if (map[x][y+1] != '#' &&
271                                map[x][y + 2] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#'
272                                && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#'
273                                && map[x + 1][y+1] != '#' && map[x - 1][y+1] != '#') {
274                            if (map[x + 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
275                                doors.add(new Point(x, y));
276                                doors.add(new Point(x, y+1));
277                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y), new Point(x, y+1));
278                                continue;
279                            }
280                        }
281                    }
282                }
283                if (map[x + 1][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#' && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#') {
284                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
285                        doors.add(new Point(x, y));
286                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y));
287                    }
288                } else if (map[x][y + 1] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#' && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#') {
289                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
290                        doors.add(new Point(x, y));
291                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y));
292                    }
293                }
294
295            }
296        }
297
298
299        return doors;
300    }
301
302    /**
303     * Generate a char[][] dungeon using TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON; this produces a dungeon appropriate for a level
304     * of ruins or a partially constructed dungeon. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for water,
305     * '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
306     * Use the addDoors, addWater, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the next generated map.
307     * @return a char[][] dungeon
308     */
309    public char[][] generate() {
310        return generate(TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON);
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Generate a char[][] dungeon given a TilesetType; the comments in that class provide some opinions on what
315     * each TilesetType value could be used for in a game. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for water,
316     * '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
317     * Use the addDoors, addWater, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the next generated map.
318     * @see squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType
319     * @param kind a TilesetType enum value, such as TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON
320     * @return a char[][] dungeon
321     */
322    public char[][] generate(TilesetType kind)
323    {
324        DungeonUtility.rng = rng;
325        char[][] map = DungeonBoneGen.wallWrap(gen.generate(kind, width, height));
326
327        HashSet<Point> floors = new HashSet<Point>();
328        HashSet<Point> doorways = new HashSet<Point>();
329        HashSet<Point> hazards = new HashSet<Point>();
330        Point temp = new Point(0, 0);
331        boolean doubleDoors = false;
332        int doorFill = 0;
333        int waterFill = 0;
334        int trapFill = 0;
335        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.DOORS))
336        {
337            doorFill = fx.get(FillEffect.DOORS);
338            if(doorFill < 0)
339            {
340                doubleDoors = true;
341                doorFill *= -1;
342            }
343        }
344        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER)) {
345            waterFill = fx.get(FillEffect.WATER);
346        }
347
348        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS)) {
349            trapFill = fx.get(FillEffect.TRAPS);
350        }
351
352        doorways = viableDoorways(doubleDoors, map);
353
354        HashSet<Point> obstacles = new HashSet<Point>(doorways.size() * doorFill / 100);
355        if(doorFill > 0)
356        {
357            int total = doorways.size() * doorFill / 100;
358
359            BigLoop:
360            for(int i = 0; i < total; i++)
361            {
362                Point entry = (Point) doorways.toArray()[rng.nextInt(doorways.size())];
363                if(map[entry.x - 1][entry.y] != '#' && map[entry.x + 1][entry.y] != '#')
364                {
365                    map[entry.x][entry.y] = '+';
366                }
367                else {
368                    map[entry.x][entry.y] = '/';
369                }
370                obstacles.add(new Point(entry));
371                Point[] adj = new Point[]{new Point(entry.x + 1, entry.y), new Point(entry.x - 1, entry.y),
372                        new Point(entry.x, entry.y + 1), new Point(entry.x, entry.y - 1)};
373                for(Point near : adj) {
374                    if (doorways.contains(near)) {
375                        map[near.x][near.y] = '#';
376                        obstacles.add(new Point(near));
377                        doorways.remove(near);
378                        i++;
379                        doorways.remove(entry);
380                        continue BigLoop;
381                    }
382                }
383                doorways.remove(entry);
384            }
385        }
386
387        for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++, temp.x = x)
388        {
389            for(int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++, temp.y = y)
390            {
391                if(map[x][y] == '.' && !obstacles.contains(temp))
392                {
393                    floors.add(new Point(x, y));
394                    int ctr = 0;
395                    if(map[x+1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
396                    if(map[x-1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
397                    if(map[x][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
398                    if(map[x][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
399                    if(map[x+1][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
400                    if(map[x-1][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
401                    if(map[x+1][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
402                    if(map[x-1][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
403                    if(ctr >= 5) hazards.add(new Point(x, y));
404                }
405            }
406        }
407        if(waterFill > 0)
408        {
409            int numPools = rng.nextInt(4) + 2 + waterFill / 20;
410            int[] volumes = new int[numPools];
411            int total = floors.size() * waterFill / 100;
412            int error = 0;
413            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++) {
414                volumes[i] = total / numPools;
415                error += volumes[i];
416            }
417            volumes[0] += total - error;
418
419            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++) {
420                int r = rng.nextInt(volumes[i] / 2) - volumes[i] / 4;
421                volumes[i] += r;
422                volumes[(i + 1) % numPools] -= r;
423            }
424            Spill spill = new Spill(map, Spill.Measurement.MANHATTAN, rng);
425            int bonusVolume = 0;
426            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++)
427            {
428                floors.removeAll(obstacles);
429                Point entry = (Point) floors.toArray()[rng.nextInt(floors.size())];
430//                spill.start(entry, volumes[i] / 3, obstacles);
431//                spill.start(entry, 2 * volumes[i] / 3, obstacles);
432                HashSet<Point> ordered = new HashSet<Point>(spill.start(entry, volumes[i], obstacles));
433                floors.removeAll(ordered);
434                hazards.removeAll(ordered);
435                obstacles.addAll(ordered);
436
437                if(spill.filled <= volumes[i])
438                {
439                    bonusVolume += volumes[i] - spill.filled;
440                }
441
442            }
443            for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++) {
444                for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++) {
445                    if(spill.spillMap[x][y])
446                        map[x][y] = '~';
447                }
448            }
449            int frustration = 0;
450            while (bonusVolume > 0 && frustration < 50)
451            {
452                Point entry = DungeonUtility.randomFloor(map);
453                ArrayList<Point> finisher = spill.start(entry, bonusVolume, obstacles);
454                for(Point p : finisher)
455                {
456                    map[p.x][p.y] = '~';
457                }
458                bonusVolume -= spill.filled;
459                hazards.removeAll(finisher);
460                frustration++;
461            }
462        }
463
464
465
466        if(trapFill > 0)
467        {
468            int total = hazards.size() * trapFill / 100;
469
470            for(int i = 0; i < total; i++)
471            {
472                Point entry = (Point) hazards.toArray()[rng.nextInt(hazards.size())];
473                map[entry.x][entry.y] = '^';
474                hazards.remove(entry);
475            }
476        }
477
478        dungeon = map;
479        return map;
480
481    }
482
483    /**
484     * Provides a string representation of the latest generated dungeon.
485     *
486     * @return
487     */
488    public String toString() {
489        char[][] trans = new char[height][width];
490        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
491            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
492                trans[y][x] = dungeon[x][y];
493            }
494        }
495        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
496        for (int row = 0; row < height; row++) {
497            sb.append(trans[row]);
498            sb.append('\n');
499        }
500        return sb.toString();
501    }
502
503}
